problem_text:
Do there exist a constant h and a function f with the following property: if a finite soluble group G admits an automorphism φ of order 4 such that |CG(φ)| ⩽ m, then G has a normal series 1 ⩽ M ⩽ N ⩽ G such that the index |G : N| does not exceed f(m), the group N/M is nilpotent of class ⩽ 2, and the group M is nilpotent of class ⩽ h?
P. V. Shumyatski˘ı
answer: Yes, there do (N. Yu. Makarenko, E. I. Khukhro, Algebra and Logic, 45 (2006), 326–343).
